1113710.1134/11137.1608-3288RadiochemistryRadiochemistry1066-36221608-3288Pleiades PublishingMoscowS1066362217010039683910.1134/S1066362217010039ArticleComplex of uranyl citraconate with dimethylacetamide: Synthesis and structureSerezhkinaL. B.1aGrigor’evM. S.2NovikovS. A.1KolotilinaM. A.1SerezhkinV. N.10000 0004 0646 1422grid.79011.3eSamara National Research Universityul. Akad. Pavlova 1443011SamaraRussia0000 0004 0620 3386grid.465278.aFrumkin Institute of Physical Chemistry and ElectrochemistryLeninskii pr. 31, korp. 4119071MoscowRussiaLserezh@samsu.ru5320171201759135402320171852016532017© Pleiades Publishing, Inc. 20172017Abstract

The complex [UO2(C5H4O4)(Dmа)] (I), where C5H4O42– is citraconate ion and Dmа is dimethylacetamide, was synthesized and studied by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. The complex has layered structure and belongs to crystal-chemical group AQ21M1 (A = UO22+, Q21 = C5H4O42–, M1 = Dmа) of uranyl complexes. Structural features of all the known uranyl complexes with citraconate anions are considered. Nonvalent interactions in the crystal structure of I are characterized using the method of molecular Voronoi–Dirichlet polyhedra. The IR spectrum of I is analyzed.

elements.content: The complex [UO2(C5H4O4)(Dmа)] (I), where C5H4O42– is citraconate ion and Dmа is dimethylacetamide, was synthesized and studied by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. The complex has layered structure and belongs to crystal-chemical group AQ21M1 (A = UO22+, Q21 = C5H4O42–, M1 = Dmа) of uranyl complexes. Structural features of all the known uranyl complexes with citraconate anions are considered. Nonvalent interactions in the crystal structure of I are characterized using the method of molecular Voronoi–Dirichlet polyhedra. The IR spectrum of I is analyzed.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The complex [UO2(C5H4O4)(Dmа)] (I), where C5H4O42- is citraconate ion and Dmа is dimethylacetamide, was synthesized and studied by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. The complex has layered structure and belongs to crystal-chemical group AQ21M1 (A = UO22+, Q21 = C5H4O42-, M1 = Dmа) of uranyl complexes. Structural features of all the known uranyl complexes with citraconate anions are considered. Nonvalent interactions in the crystal structure of I are characterized using the method of molecular Voronoi-Dirichlet polyhedra. The IR spectrum of I is analyzed.
